result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony A. Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.203(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Identity Theft - Obtain Money or Credit

supervisions.notes:
AS TO COUNTS 4, 5, and 6: Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of ES. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
- RESTITUTION IS SET AT ZERO.

Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank; pay all appropriate costs.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION TO INCLUDE:
- Counseling needs to be determined.
- Seek/maintain full-time employment.
- Perform 20 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization. (TOTAL of 40 hours).

records.addlTxt: Order DENYING Sentence Adjustment signed and filed.  Copies to the District Attorney's Office and defendant.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Thomas J. McAdams, Br. 7, for review. spc

Order to Correct Clerical Error as to 3-1-2016 entry, signed and filed.
AS TO COUNTS 5 and 6, the period of probation imposed was 4 YEARS.
To include counts 5 & 6/Def. IS eligible for CIP and SAP.

Defendant Anthony A. Coleman in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Anthony A. Coleman in custody.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to negotiations, the defendant will enter pleas to counts 4, 5, and 6:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered pleas of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  Court makes a finding of habituality as to each count.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Counts 1 and 7 through 11 ordered dismissed and read in for sentencing.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by counsels and the defendant.
RESTITUTION IS SET AT ZERO.
Count 4:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 52 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
DEFENDANT IS REMANDED.
Counts 5 and 6, concurrent with each other and consecutive to count 4:      The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 4 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 0 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 4 MONTHS.  Conditions of probation include:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections  and as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Counseling needs to be determined.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Perform 20 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.(TOTAL of 40 hours)
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Filed: CR-218; CR-233; CR-234; Pretrial Credit
Original GUILTY PLEA & SENTENCING Transcript (22 pages) commencing 03-01-2016 received and filed.  CH

Attorney Robert Buckett in court, defendant Anthony A. Coleman not in court, in custody.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and an offer from the State and requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Protective Order signed and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
State's Motion for Protective Order Pursuant to Wisconsin Statute Section 971.23(6) with attached proposed order received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Anthony A. Coleman in court with attorney Robert Buckett.  Defendant Anthony A. Coleman in custody.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Co-Actors Angela Staten, Sharon Staten, Tawanda Staten and James Cross

Defendant Anthony A. Coleman in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Anthony A. Coleman in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
